Key Arguments: The definitions of harm in the legislation are too broad and lack context.
Harm should be assessed on a case-by-case basis, considering the broader context.
The current definitions could lead to regulatory abuse.
Notable Quotes: In my opinion harm can only be properly understood in the broader context of the content that is being described as misinformation or disinformation and only on a carefully considered case-by-case basis.
None of the above definitions of harm can accurately be considered as harmful if the broader context of the information relating to that 'harm' is not also carefully considered.
